description.narrative: Establishment of a Sub-regional Multidisciplinary Task Force (SMTF) to better address development challenges of the Syrian-related crisis

participating-org.narrative: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
SDC-Swiss Agency For Development and Co

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: -Budget requirement for resilience component at the country and regional level increased -Number of knowledge products published -Number of joint programe increased.

comment.narrative: -Resilience component in the 3RP is mainstreamed (in terms of programming and funding) -Knowledge products related to resilience response published (include policy papers) -Increase resilience partners among donors, UN agencies and private sectors.

International, national and regional consultative processes and response plans to the Syria crisis include development principles, pillars and strategic frameworks based on a resilience-based development approach. -Ensure resilience component is mainstreamed in the 3RP. Knowledge products and advisory services on operationalizing a resilience-based development response to the Syria crisis result in more effective responses by the Regional UN Development Group and UNDP to the Syria crisis. • • Provide support to COs operational framework • Carry out advisory services on innovation & gender equality to UNDP Country Offices and ensure on-going support. -Cross boarder Socio-economic analysis conducted to facilitate re-integration in Syria. UNDP Country Offices in the sub-region are supported with outreach and tools for expanding strategic partnership and mobilizing resources for a resilience-based development response to the Syria crisis. • Provide advisory services on private sector engagement to Country Offices. • Organize sub-regional Innovation Jam with private sector partners.

-Organized side event for Resilience at the Brussels IV with participation of over XX partners (UN, Governments, donors and I/NGOs) in June 2020. -Organized Vulnerability and Resilience measurement workshop with over 30 UN and I/NGO partners in Nov 2020 to take stock of on-going practice and applications to the 3RP monitoring framework. -3RP was well coordinated at the country and regional level and produced the Regional Needs Overview (RNO) and the Regional Strategic Overview (RSO), Mid-year report and COVID-19 appeal. -Upon the request from UNDP Jordan, provided resilience training for GBV working group partners.

International, national and regional consultative processes and response plans to the Syria crisis include development principles, pillars and strategic frameworks based on a resilience-based development approach. -Ensure resilience component is mainstreamed in the 3RP. Knowledge products and advisory services on operationalizing a resilience-based development response to the Syria crisis result in more effective responses by the Regional UN Development Group and UNDP to the Syria crisis. • Carry-out a study on the Socioeconomic profiling of Syrian refugees and vulnerable communities (desegregated by gender) to identify both, professional/skills background and social and economic expectations • Analysis of innovative solutions and collection of good practices from UNDP and UNHCR. • Provide support to COs operational framework • Carry out advisory services on innovation & gender equality to UNDP Country Offices and ensure on-going support. -Cross boarder Socio-economic analysis conducted to facilitate re-integration in Syria. UNDP Country Offices in the sub-region are supported with outreach and tools for expanding strategic partnership and mobilizing resources for a resilience-based development response to the Syria crisis. • Provide advisory services on private sector engagement to Country Offices. • Organize sub-regional Innovation Jam with private sector partners.

-Research conducted on Womens Economic inclusion in context of the Syria crisis and H-D Nexus. -I4C events with Finnish private sector participation organized Q1 (in Finland and Jordan). -Provided training to the MOPIC prior to the Jordan Response Plan 2020 planning to mainstream resilience lens. -Advisory services to mainstream resilience provided to Jordan and Iraq. -Cross-border information sharing meeting held in Sept with UNDP Syria and Lebanon. -Represent resilience/development partners at the international conference (such as TDG)

The resilience response is effectively coordinated at sub-regional level and integrated and adapted in country response plans and monitoring frameworks - Regular and substantive support to the annual 3RP sub-regional planning and prioritization, monitoring and reporting activities - Advocacy and resource mobilization support for the resilience response in major donor fora on the Syrian crisis - Coordination between 3RP resilience planning processes and the resilience response inside Syria (incl. Joint 3RP-HRP meeting..) Strengthened and evolved resilience approach to improve programming at regional and country level and better respond both to the crisis and rising vulnerabilities in the sub-region - Vulnerability and Resilience Tracking and Measurement workshops and reports - Selected briefs/discussion papers and consultations on specific emerging issues (incl. on Covid19 MT/LT socioeconomic impacts, Durable Solutions) - Annual Regional Future of Resilience Meetings - Consultations with IFIs on synergies between the 3RP resilience response and IFIs response Fostering knowledge and innovation - Analyzing good practices/success stories (private sector engagement, use of digital technologies) in building resilience to the crisis - Disseminating findings on good practices and success stories and organising demand-driven multi-stakeholder in-country and/or regional workshops (including under I4C initiative, and mobilization of other private sector networks)
